title: Destroy Claim
description: This is the JSON schema of the Destroy Claim Core Model.

extension.title: Destroy Claim Extension
extension.description: This is the extension schema of a Destroy Claim.

id.title: Destroy Claim Extension Identifier
id.description: A unique id of the destroy claim extension

name.description: The name of an extension to be used. To avoid global collisions a self controlled domain can be used as name.

schema.description: A reference to a JSON schema, which describes the payload of the extension. In the best case, the schema can be obtained via a given reference.

comment.description: Sometimes a human readable comment is helpful and can be added here

conditions.$comment: see here for a non official JSON Logic schema: https://github.com/axa-ch/json-logic-js/tree/master/schemas

id.title: Destroy Claim Identifier
id.description: A unique id of the destroy claim
id.$comment: The unique id has a fixed prefix to identify that it is a destroyclaim. The UUID part should be generated as UUIDv4.

title.title: Title
title.description: A name given to the destroy claim.
title.$comment: Destroy Claims should have easy to understand names that try to describe what it is about. May be omitted when destroy claims are handeled fully automated.

description.title: Description
description.description: A detailed description of the destroy claim.
description.$comment: Description may include but is not limited to: an abstract, a table of contents, a graphical representation, or a free-text account of the resource.
examples: We need to delete the test data, because it contains errors.

keywords.title: Keywords
keywords.description: Keywords which tags the destroy claim
keywords.$comment: Keywords should be used to make the destroy claims easier to find in a catalog system

items.title: Keyword
items.$comment: A keyword should consist of no more than three individual words to improve discoverability.

issued.title: Date Issued
issued.description: Date of formal issuance of the destroy claim.

modified.title: Date Modified
modified.description: Date on which the destroy claim was changed.

versionInfo.title: Version Info
versionInfo.description: A string describing the version of the entity

versionNotes.title: Version notes
versionNotes.description: A string giving additional information on the current version
examples: This is a new release with awesome features

modelVersion.title: Destroy Claim Version
modelVersion.description: A string giving the version of the used destroy claim model.

isActive.title: Is Active
isActive.description: Indicates if a destroy claim is active.
isActive.$comment: At design time, a destroy claim should not be executed. A destroy claim should only be active when all measures have been completed.

strictMode.title: Strict Mode
strictMode.description: Indicates if the agent should run in strict mode.

manualMode.title: Manual Mode
manualMode.description: Indicates whether the agent requires a human actor to approve the deletion.

notificationMode.title: Notification Mode
notificationMode.description: Indicates if the agent need to notify a human actor on deletion.

simulationMode.title: Simulation Mode
simulationMode.description: Indicates if the agent should run in simulation mode.

expirationDate.title: Expiration Date
expirationDate.description: Date when this destroy claim is not valid anymore.

destroyContacts.title: Destroy Contacts List
destroyContacts.description: A list of contacts. It depends on the specific extension how what is modeled.

destroySubjects.title: Destroy Subject List
destroySubjects.description: Describes what should be deleted. It depends on the specific extension how it is modeled.

destroyReasons.title: Why to destroy data
destroyReasons.description: A list of reasons why the data must be deleted can be specified. Free text is allowed. A controlled set in which reasons can be addressed by URI SHOULD be used. This increases reusability and interpretability.

conditions.$comment: see here for a non official JSON Logic schema: https://github.com/axa-ch/json-logic-js/tree/master/schemas
